meanings.definition: A strong impulse or desire to start fires.
meanings.sent1: His pyromania led him to light matches in secret.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter was trained to recognize signs of pyromania in suspects.
meanings.sent3: The campfire seemed to whisper to him, tempting his pyromania.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for candles bordered on pyromania, lighting up every room.
meanings.sent5: The news report vividly described the dangers of untreated pyromania.

meanings.definition: An obsessive fascination with fire and arson.
meanings.sent1: The detective suspected the arsonist had a case of pyromania.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts related to historical cases of pyromania.
meanings.sent3: His friends joked that his pyromania made him the best at lighting birthday candles.
meanings.sent4: The artist's pyromania inspired a series of fiery paintings.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the villain's pyromania as a symbol of destruction.
